Compares a {{tt|sub_match}} to another {{tt|sub_match}}, a {{lc|std::string}}, a C-style string or a single character.

@1-7@ Compares two {{tt|sub_match}} directly.

@8-20@ Compares a {{tt|sub_match}} with a {{lc|std::basic_string}}.

@21-33@ Compares a {{tt|sub_match}} with a C-style string.

@34-46@ Compares a {{tt|sub_match}} with a single character.

{{rrev|since=c++20|
{{cpp/note synthesized compare}}
}}

@47@ {{tti|value-type-of}}{{sep}}{{c/core|&lt;BidirIt&gt;}} is the [[cpp/iterator#Types and writability|value type]] of {{tt|BidirIt}}.

@48@ {{tti|cat-type-of}}{{sep}}{{c/core|&lt;BidirIt&gt;}} is the result type of three-way comparison of {{c/core|std::sub_match&lt;BidirIt&gt;}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|lhs, rhs|a {{tt|sub_match}} to compare}}
{{par|str|a {{lc|std::basic_string}} to compare}}
{{par|s|a pointer to a C-style string to compare}}
{{par|ch|a character to compare}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Let {{c|target}} be the following values:
@1-7@ {{c|rhs}}
@8-20@ {{c|typename std::sub_match&lt;BidirIt&gt;::string_type(str.data(), str.size())}}
@21-33@ {{c|s}}
@34-46@ {{c|typename std::sub_match&lt;BidirIt&gt;::string_type(1, ch)}}

The return values are defined as follows:
{|class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;"
!rowspan=2|{{nbsp}}Operator{{nbsp}}
!colspan=2|Return value
|-
!Overloads {{v|1-14,21-27,34-40}}&lt;br&gt;{{normal|{{small|(overloads with parameter {{c|lhs}})}}}}
!{{nbsp|6}}Overloads {{v|15-20,28-33,41-46}}{{nbsp|6}}&lt;br&gt;{{normal|{{small|(overloads without parameter {{c|lhs}})}}}}
|-
|{{tt|1===}}
|{{c|1=lhs.compare(target) == 0}}
|{{c|1=rhs.compare(target) == 0}}
|-
|{{tt|1=!=}}
|{{c|1=lhs.compare(target) != 0}}
|{{c|1=rhs.compare(target) != 0}}
|-
|{{tt|&lt;}}
|{{c|lhs.compare(target) &lt; 0}}
|{{c|rhs.compare(target) &gt; 0}}
|-
|{{tt|1=&lt;=}}
|{{c|1=lhs.compare(target) &lt;= 0}}
|{{c|1=rhs.compare(target) &gt;= 0}}
|-
|{{tt|&gt;}}
|{{c|lhs.compare(target) &gt; 0}}
|{{c|rhs.compare(target) &lt; 0}}
|-
|{{tt|1=&gt;=}}
|{{c|1=lhs.compare(target) &gt;= 0}}
|{{c|1=rhs.compare(target) &lt;= 0}}
|-
|{{tt|1=&lt;=&gt;}}
|{{nbsp}}&lt;span style="text-align: start;"&gt;{{box|{{c/core|static_cast&lt;}}{{tti|cat-type-of}}{{sep}}{{c/core|1=&lt;BidirIt&gt;&gt;}}&lt;br&gt;{{nbspt|4}}{{c/core|1=(lhs.compare(target) &lt;=&gt; 0)}}}}&lt;/span&gt;{{nbsp}}
|{{n/a}}
|}

===Notes===
The return type of {{c/core|1=operator&lt;=&gt;}} is guaranteed to be a comparison category type. If {{tti|value-type-of}}{{sep}}{{c/core|&lt;BidirIt&gt;}} is {{c/core|char}}, {{c/core|wchar_t}}, {{c/core|char8_t}}, {{c/core|char16_t}}, or {{c/core|char32_t}}, the return type of {{tt|1=operator&lt;=&gt;}} is {{ltt std|cpp/utility/compare/strong_ordering}}.
